name: TomOS Portfolio
tagline: Cinematic interactive portfolio and personal OS.
overview: FocusedOnTom is a premium cinematic portfolio that feels like a story-driven operating system. The experience blends a 3D universe background, an in-app terminal, and adaptive quality so it stays smooth on any device.
problem: Portfolios often feel like static brochures. I wanted a space that could convey craft, personality, and depth without sacrificing performance or accessibility.
solution: A hybrid 3D + 2D interface (TomOS) with a boot sequence, galaxy-style project navigation, and a terminal for power users. Quality tiers and reduced-motion support keep it inclusive.
highlights: TomOS boot sequence and universe background
Project Galaxy with deterministic node layout and connection lines
Terminal with autocomplete and personality-driven responses
Adaptive quality (tier 1–3) and performance mode
Full reduced-motion and keyboard accessibility

name: Design System Lab
overview: Internal design system that powers FocusedOnTom: cosmic color tokens, glass panels, and reusable motion primitives. Built for consistency and theming.
problem: Ad-hoc styles and duplicated motion logic make it hard to keep the product feeling cohesive and accessible.
solution: A single token layer (CSS + JS), shared GlassPanel and typography components, and motion helpers that respect reduced-motion preferences.
highlights: Mint / ice / purple cosmic palette with glows
GlassPanel with panel/solid variants and optional glow
FadeIn and PageTransition with reduced-motion variants
Tailwind theme wired to design tokens

name: Terminal CLI
tagline: VS Code–style command palette and shell.
overview: In-app terminal that mimics a dev-friendly CLI: commands, autocomplete, history, and a bit of personality. Built to feel like part of TomOS rather than a separate tool.
problem: Users expect quick navigation and discovery; a traditional nav alone doesn’t offer that sense of power and play.
solution: A launcher (keyboard or UI) opens a terminal panel. Commands like open, projects, and help are available with suggestions and optional navigation.
highlights: Command suggestions and autocomplete
History and personality responses
Open command for routes and project slugs
Glass panel styling consistent with shell

name: Universe Scene
overview: The R3F-powered background that gives the portfolio its cosmic feel. Starfield, navigable nodes, and a camera that can switch between guided path and free orbit.
problem: 3D can be heavy; it had to scale down on low-end devices and respect reduced motion.
solution: Quality tiers control DPR, particle count, and post-processing. Guided views drive the camera to named positions; free mode enables full orbit. Reduced motion can pause or simplify the scene.
highlights: Quality tiers 1–3 with automatic detection
Guided camera views (hero, skills, projects, lab, lifestyle)
Free exploration mode with orbit controls
Lazy-loaded canvas and optional placeholder

name: Motion Toolkit
overview: Reusable motion components and patterns: fade-in, page transition, and scroll-triggered section reveals. All respect prefers-reduced-motion and app-level reducedMotion state.
problem: Animation can exclude users who prefer reduced motion; it also had to feel consistent across the product.
solution: Centralized reducedMotion from store and media query, and components that shorten or remove motion when appropriate.
highlights: FadeIn with optional delay and reduced-motion skip
PageTransition with drift and duration reduction
Section reveal on scroll (used in project pages)
Single source for motion tokens

name: API Gateway
overview: A small API gateway side project: reverse proxy, rate limiting, and optional caching. Used as a learning exercise for Node and Redis.
problem: I wanted to understand gateway patterns and rate limiting without adopting a heavy framework.
solution: Minimal Node + TypeScript service with configurable routes, Redis-backed rate limits, and simple health checks.
highlights: Route-based proxy and rewrite rules
Redis-backed rate limiting per key
Health and readiness endpoints
Docker-friendly deployment
